string.text: The M1928 is a primary variant of the Thompson, an American submachine gun, invented by John T. Thompson in 1918, that became infamous during the Prohibition era, being a signature weapon of various crime syndicates in the United States. Later on it became the service weapon of US military as the primary submachine gun in the World War II. M1928 has front grip and muzzle device mounted by default.

The M1A1 is a simplified military variant of Thompson, an American submachine gun, invented by John T. Thompson in 1918, that became infamous during the Prohibition era, being a signature weapon of various crime syndicates in the United States. Later on it became the service weapon of US military as the primary submachine gun in the World War II. M1A1 differs from M1928 mainly by simplified front handguard instead of front grip and lack of muzzle device.

Standard 30 round Thompson submachine gun magazine chambered in .45 acp. The Thompson is not a gun that many would expect to find in the zone, perhaps a gunsmith with peculiar tastes has been producing copies.

50-round Thompson magazine for the Thompson submachine gun. Normally the M1A1 pattern of Thompson possesses a different mag weld that does not accept drums, however, aftermarket modifications have made them compatible.
